title: Yasuo and Lee Sin will not reach a 100% ban rate with 10 bans
body:
I don't even think their ban rates will increase that much by comparison to more meta picks. There are just better overall picks at the moment than those 2 to justify using bans on them. An increase in Yasuo ban will more likely have to with avoiding the match ups that he is actually really good into rather than because he is "op". Since certain roles are rarely target banned, Lee Sin isn't high enough on the jg pecking order to take priority over other jg champions to ban out. 

Do not get your hopes up or expect some kind of miraculous ban rate increase on those 2 when more ban are allowed. If anyone was ever in a pick/ban state like {{champion:38}}  used to be, that champion would be hot fixed or gutted almost immediately.

I don't think there is a champion that will reach 100% ban rate at all. There is always a difference in point of view when it comes to who to ban. Some people just ban the OPs while others ban champs they just don't like playing against. This leads to a lot of diversity when it comes to pick/ban phases.
I felt like making this after seeing some of the posts that made it to the top. Apparently Yasuo and lee sin are unstoppable gods that will finally be banished to the shadow realm with 10 bans.

I know there is a lot of hype around those champs but both can be counter and beaten pretty badly if they get counterpicked. I guess for me it's not that big of an issue because I play counters for both of them. {{champion:254}} beats lee {{champion:86}}{{champion:58}}  eats yas pretty easily.

I learned to deal with them a long time ago, I don't play weak early game junglers that are highly vulnerable to invades or laners that are weak to yasuo. He does have obnoxious match ups though, which I would consider worth banning. otherwise there are better bans.
